intro: Maerua edulis, commonly known as the sour fig or African sour plum, is a shrub or small tree native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy, edible fruits that are often consumed raw or cooked. The plant has small, alternate leaves and produces yellow flowers that are pollinated by insects. Its fruit is rich in vitamin C and is used in traditional medicine for its antioxidant properties. Maerua edulis is well adapted to harsh environments and plays an important role in local ecosystems and food security.
